abstract: Oregon is one of first states to allow expunging of past marijuana convictions after voting to decriminalize substance in November 2014; state, which will allow retail sales of marijuana starting in October, is forging new legal trail as it revises rules in effort to remove stigma of criminal record; measure will affect debate in other states poised to legalize pot, even as it highlights Oregon's unique approach to and history with decriminalization.
lead_paragraph: In preparation for retail marijuana sales on Oct. 1, the state is making it possible for people to have past marijuana convictions removed from their criminal record.

headline.main: Oregon’s Legal Sale of Marijuana Comes With Reprieve
headline.print_headline: Oregon’s Legal Marijuana Comes With Reprieve

snippet: In preparation for retail marijuana sales on Oct. 1, the state is making it possible for people to have past marijuana convictions removed from their criminal record.
